text:
**Key Points:**

* England's James Anderson, a 42-year-old retired Test cricketer, is a surprise target for Major League Cricket (MLC) in the United States.
* Anderson may participate in the third edition of the T20 tournament next year, potentially earning £135,000 for a short stint.
* MLC has already lured prominent players such as Australia's Pat Cummins, Steve Smith, Glenn Maxwell, and Travis Head, with Cummins having a lucrative contract until 2027.
* The Washington Freedom team, coached by Ricky Ponting, won the 2024 edition of the tournament.
* MLC has influential backers, including Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella, and aims to attract top English players.
* The league, launched in 2023, will expand to 34 games in 2025 and has been granted official List A status.

**Additional Context:**

* Anderson has not played competitive T20 cricket since 2014 but believes he is fit and good enough to play the format.
* England World Cup winners Liam Plunkett and Jason Roy have previously participated in MLC, with Roy signing a two-year deal with the Los Angeles Knight Riders worth £300,000.

* Jimmy Anderson, England's all-time leading Test wicket-taker, is a surprise target for MLC, with an unnamed team willing to offer him up to £135,000 for a short stint in the US.
* MLC debuted in 2023 with six teams representing major cities, and the 2024 season has just concluded with Washington Freedom winning the title.
* Other notable players who have played in MLC include Australian trio Pat Cummins, Steve Smith, and Glenn Maxwell.
* The league has sparked controversy, such as when Jason Roy chose to play in MLC instead of for county side Surrey, sacrificing his £70,000 white ball deal for a two-year contract worth £300,000.
* The league has expressed its desire to attract more of England's top players in the future.

* James Anderson, England's all-time leading Test wicket-taker, is being considered by at least one MLC franchise for the 2025 season, following his hints at a potential return to white-ball cricket.
* Anderson could earn around €1,35,000 (approximately ₹1.49 crore) for a short stint in the competition.
* The MLC tournament is set to expand from 19 to 34 games in 2025.

* The league is backed by influential figures such as Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella.

This year's tournament was won by the Washington Freedom outfit, coached by Ricky Ponting.

* Anderson's experience and skill could elevate the MLC's profile, mentor younger players, and attract more fans and investors to the league.
* His participation could be a catalyst in making cricket a mainstream sport in America, bringing his expertise in swing bowling to conditions that might favor such skills.

* The league aims to attract more top English players in the future, with Jason Roy being a recent example, who chose to play for Los Angeles Knight Riders instead of Surrey, giving up his £70,000 white-ball contract for a two-year deal worth £300,000.
